title: encryption: upgrade from oc 4.5.13 to 5.0.8 breaks libreoffice files
body:
### expected behaviour
no files should be broken during the upgrade process

### actual behaviour
after upgrading oc from 4.5.13 to 5.0.8 the libreoffice files like .odp, .odt or .odg where broken on my system. after doing a diff between my backup and the current files it's always the same pattern for all files. and this only happens for libreoffice files which have the last three of four ^@ chars missing.

the working file contains something like this in the last line:

    ^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@6$^@^@styles.xmlpk^a^b^t^@^t^@^h^h^h^@/hã¡bâª^@ã¥ã‡^r^a^@^@ãž^c^@^@^u^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^[.^@^@meta-inf/manifest.xmlpk^e^f^@^@^@^@^p^@^p^@6^d^@^@p/^@^@^@^@

but the last line of the broken file contains this:

    ^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@6$^@^@styles.xmlpk^a^b^t^@^t^@^h^h^h^@/hã¡bâª^@ã¥ã‡^r^a^@^@ãž^c^@^@^u^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^@^[.^@^@meta-inf/manifest.xmlpk^e^f^@^@^@^@^p^@^p^@6^d^@^@p/

(note the missing ^@ at the end of the file after the p/)

i don't know if this is something special because only libreoffice files are broken. maybe someone has any clue whats happening here or is able to reproduce this?

### steps to reproduce
1. have a running oc 4.5.13 with the old encryption app enabled
2. delete all existing files except config.php and /data in the oc folder
3. copy the new files of oc 5.0.8 to the owncloud dir
4. started the upgrade process with opening my oc url

### server configuration
operating system: debian

web server: nginx

database: mysql

php version: 5.4.x

owncloud version: 4.5.13 to 5.0.8

### logs
nothing special in here.
